definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
Da Yuan Dayitongzhi, Yuan dynasty geographical encyclopedia, compiled 1285-1294 under Jamal al-Din 紮馬剌丁|扎马剌丁 and Yu Yinglong 虞應龍|虞应龙, 755 scrolls
Da Yuan Dayitongzhi, Yuan dynasty geographical encyclopedia, compiled 1285-1294 under Jamal al-Din 紮馬剌丁|扎马剌丁 and Yu Yinglong 虞應龍|虞应龙, 755 scrolls
pinyin: Da4 Yuan2 Da4 yi1 tong3 zhi4

sentences.english: The transgenic canola plants are not about to take over the world.
sentences.chinese: 轉基因油菜作物不可能將一統天下。

sentences.english: It had been nineteen years since Yellow Emperor unified the country.
sentences.chinese: 黃帝一統天下已經十九年了。

sentences.english: Yet the process of telling a story doesn't have to be unidirectional.
sentences.chinese: 然而講故事的程式並不需要大一統。

sentences.english: Before modern times the "Old-Learning" had an absolute predomination in the educational field.
sentences.chinese: 近代以前，中國社會以傳統的“舊學”教育一統天下。

sentences.english: Marxist ideology dominating the world, academia, of course, exemplifies the exception.
sentences.chinese: 馬克思主義思想一統天下，學術界當然是莫能例外。

sentences.english: In a globalized world, beauty standards tend to merge.
sentences.chinese: 在全球化的現在，美的標準趨向一統。

sentences.english: The weather gets cold in November, and nothing is better than staying at your familiar hotel, working hard.
sentences.chinese: 在這初冬寒風起的十一月，還是躲進小樓成一統。

sentences.english: The occurrence and the development of the social insurance broke the law of tot's monopolization situation.
sentences.chinese: 社會保險的產生和發展打破了侵權法一統天下的局面。

sentences.english: In the integrated world, "The Great Mystery" goes in an opposite direction.
sentences.chinese: 在這個一統的世界裏，大陰走的是不同的方向。

sentences.english: The first legacy is the concept of “Great Unity” so entrenched in Chinese people’s minds.
sentences.chinese: 首先是深入人心的中華民族“大一統”觀念。

sentences.english: Neither Apple nor Google has grabbed much, if anything, from that lot.
sentences.chinese: 無論是蘋果還是谷歌，都沒有足夠的實力一統天下。
第一章涉及的是“大一統”問題。

sentences.english: Then crystal scraps of all these rising in the dazzling beams added to their sum.
sentences.chinese: 於是一切耀眼光中上升的破片都匯成一統。

sentences.english: If Shu rule all the land, chopping and not cut is right.
sentences.chinese: 若是蜀國一統天下了，斬與不斬就都是對的了。

definition: the hardships of beginning an undertaking (idiom)
internal trouble and outside aggression (idiom); in a mess both domestically and abroad
(lit.) leftover men/(fig.) loyalist adherents of a former dynasty/surviving members of an ethnic group
to revere as sole orthodoxy/to hold supremacy (of a religion, ideology, cultural norm, social group etc)/to be dominant
Nêdong county, Tibetan: Sne gdong rdzong, in Lhokha prefecture 山南地區|山南地区[Shan1 nan2 di4 qu1], Tibet
Longsha district of Qiqihar city 齊齊哈爾|齐齐哈尔[Qi2 qi2 ha1 er3], Heilongjiang
